abstract.para: This data package contains data that is used to test the metadata quality check engine that has been developed by the Metadata Improvement and Guidance Project
There are 3 tables in this dataset produced by us. This metadata document is intended to be used only for testing the metadata quality engine.

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: Controlled Vocabulary v1: Core Research Areas

listitem.para: The user of this data agrees to contact the data owner (i.e., the SBC investigator responsible for data) prior to publishing. Where appropriate, users whose projects are integrally dependent on our data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with the data owner.

The user agrees to cite the authors in all publications that use our data by including the following statement in the Acknowledgments: "Data were provided by the Santa Barbara Science, funded by the US Science Foundation (OCE-0000000)".
The user agrees to send the full citation of any publication using our data to science@example.com

section.title: CTD Instrumentation, collection and analysis
section.para: CTD data are collected and analyzed according to the following protocols and instruments

protocol.title: SBC Monthly Water Sampling - CTD and bottles

methodStep.instrumentation: SBE19-Plus with rosette sampler (Go-Flo) and bottles drained under pressure (june 2008 - present)

section.title: Nutrients
section.para: Nutrients were collected according to the following protocols

section.title: Particulate C and N and stable isotopes (C and N)
section.para: Samples for CHN and stable isotope analysis are processed according to the following protocols.

protocol.title: CHN and Stable Isotope Filtration 2009 - present

section.title: Fluorometric chlorophyll
section.para: Samples for chlorophyll and related pigments (chlorophyll-a, total chlorophyll and phaeopigments) are filtered and analyzed according to the following protocols

section.title: Biogenic and lithogenic silica
section.para: Samples for biogenic and lithogenic silica were prepared and analyzed according to the following protcols. Note: BSi and LSi were processed only during 2001.

section.title: Visualization Software: Ocean Data View
section.para: These data were designed to be loaded into the visualization program "Ocean Data View". See links for more information.

protocol.title: README: Using Ocean Data View with data

software.title: Hi-Resolution Bathymetry for Santa Barbara Channel (ODVinstall_SBCbathy.exe)

project.title: Santa Barbara Coastal Long Term Ecological Research Project

section.para: The primary research objective of Science is to investigate the importance of land and ocean processes in structuring giant kelp (Macrocystis pyrifera) forest ecosystems. As in many temperate regions, the shallow rocky reefs in the Santa Barbara Channel, California, are dominated by giant kelp forests. Because of their close proximity to shore, kelp forests are influenced by physical and biological processes occurring on land as well as in the open ocean. Research focuses on measuring and modeling the patterns, transport, and processing of material constituents (e.g., nutrients, carbon, sediment, organisms, and pollutants) from terrestrial watersheds and the coastal ocean to these reefs. Specifically, we are examining the effects of these material inputs on the primary production of kelp, and the population dynamics, community structure, and trophic interactions of kelp forest ecosystems.

dataTable.entityName: Monthly CTD downcasts, registered stations, all years
dataTable.entityDescription: CTD data from monthly downcasts at REGISTERED stations at or near reefs, averaged over 1m bins. File format is acceptable input for Ocean Data View.
dataTable.additionalInfo: This data table was designed to be loaded into the Ocean Data View program. The program is avaliable from the publisher at http://odv.awi-bremerhaven.de/ . High resolution bathymetry for the Santa Barbara Channel to be installed with ODV can be provided by request.

dataTable.entityName: Monthly bottle chemistry with CTD, registered stations, all years
dataTable.entityDescription: Nutrients, pigments, particulates, etc from rosette bottles or pump, plus corresponding CTD data (from Seabird "btl file") at REGISTERED stations. No bottle samples collected at non-registered stations.
dataTable.additionalInfo: This data table was designed to be loaded into the Ocean Data View program. The program is avaliable from the publisher at http://odv.awi.de. High resolution bathymetry for the Santa Barbara Channel to be installed with ODV can be be provided by request.

dataTable.entityName: Monthly CTD downcasts, non-registered stations, all years
dataTable.entityDescription: CTD data from opportunistic and ad hoc downcasts at NON-REGISTERED stations, averaged over 1m bins. File format is acceptable input for Ocean Data View.
dataTable.additionalInfo: Casts are often collected opportunistically for ancillary projects. These stations do not have standard SBC names, and codes do not necessarily refer to unique locations. Contact us for more information. This data table was designed to be loaded into the Ocean Data View program. The program is avaliable from the publisher at http://odv.awi-bremerhaven.de/ . High resolution bathymetry for the Santa Barbara Channel to be installed with ODV can be provided by request.

stmml:unit.name: dimensionless
stmml:unit.stmml:description: a designation asserting the absence of an associated unit

stmml:unit.name: microgramPerLiter
stmml:unit.stmml:description: concentration unit. Based on the dimensions (mass/volume), the unitType is probably density, but this would be misleading, so it is left NULL here.

stmml:unit.name: micromolePerLiter
stmml:unit.stmml:description: commonly used for concentration of some chemical constituents of natural water bodies, e.g., nutrients. It has the same magnitude as micromolar, but micromolar can only be used for a dissolved constituent

stmml:unit.name: milligramPerMeterCubed
stmml:unit.stmml:description: concentration unit, sometimes used for pigments in natural waters.same magnitude as microgramPerLiter

stmml:unit.name: nominalYear
stmml:unit.stmml:description: one year excluding leap seconds and leap days, 31536000 seconds

stmml:unit.name: percent
stmml:unit.stmml:description: ratio of two quantities as percent composition (1:100)

stmml:unit.name: permil
stmml:unit.stmml:description: permil is a shorthand way of saying parts per thousand parts. values must have the same dimensions.

stmml:unit.name: siemensPerMeter
stmml:unit.stmml:description: siemens per meter (electrolytic conductivity of a solution)
